intro: Mitostigma barbatum, commonly known as the hairy mitostigma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a slightly serrated edge. Mitostigma barbatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
